quizz_info_1: Thyroxine is a tyrosine-based hormone used in case of hypothyroidism (not enough thyroid hormones are produced from the thyroid gland) as these hormones are mainly responsible for the regulation of the metabolism. Mid-2017, Levothyrox (thyroxineâ€™s trade name), one of the most commonly prescribed drugs in France, is at the center of a controversy as thousands of people using the new formula, released in March 2017, complain of serious side effects.
quizz_info_2: For more information about the synthesis, see: Tetrahedron Lett. 1997, 38, 6965-6968. For more information about the controversy of Levothyrox in France, see: https://www.thelocal.fr/20170824/france-levothyrox-controversy-thryoid-treatment-thousands-of-patients-side-effects
